channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Perl Developer who wants to learn Scala and NodeJS - West London
item.description: Love Perl but want to skill-up on another stack at your employerâ€™s expense? Client is a major and dynamics UK company with a large (and pretty Modern) Perl codebase who have started extended their technical stack to include Scala and NodeJS.

item.title: London's Trendiest Office Space - Lead and Mid-Level Perl Developer roles
item.description: I love working in a vibrant, modern space. If youâ€™re going to spend all day at work, it might as well be somewhere you enjoy being, rather than a cubicle farm. This client has a workspace Iâ€™m actively jealous of!

item.title: Distraction-free Workplace - Escape Standups and Scrum - Perl Developer West London
item.description: Personally, I love Agile and Scrum so much I wrote a set of blog articles detailing why I love them so much. But itâ€™s not everyone's cup of tea. SomeÂ people yearn for being given a two-week task, going away, and getting it done well by themselves, or in consultation with highly technical and well-read colleagues.

item.title: Web Application Development in Perl 6
item.description: Crowd funding for a book about Web Application Development in Perl 6

item.title: YAPC::Fukuoka
item.description: July 01, 2017, LINE Fukuokaæ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾, Hakata-Ku, Fukuoka, Japan

item.title: Madrid Perl Workshop 2017
item.description: The Madrid Perl workshop is on June 3rd.

item.title: The Perl Conference 2017 in DC
item.description: The Perl Conference runs from the 19th June through the 21st, with a day of tutorials before, and two days of tutorials afterwards.

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop - Damian on Board (Again)
item.description: The Swiss Perl workshop is on the 25th and 25th of August, and Damian Conway will be attending this year (Damian blogged about this too!).

item.title: Intro to Moose at the Perl Conference
item.description: Dave will be offering his Introduction to Moose class at the perl conference again this year.

item.title: Neil Bowers's report
item.description: My report on the things I worked on at the summit.

item.title: Fixing CPAN distributions without a META file
item.description: One of the problems with CPAN is releases that don't have a META.yml or META.json file. We want to try and fix these, particularly those that are used by other CPAN distributions.

item.title: The (YAML and Perl Toolchain) Summits
item.description: Two reports for the price of one! Before the toolchain summit, Tina and Ingy had a YAML summit in Berlin. At the toolchain summit Tina worked with Ingy on the YAML module, and other YAML tools.

item.title: Twin Peaks (YAML Walk with Me)
item.description: Ingy worked on the YAML module, and various related tools and modules.

item.title: Doug Bell's report
item.description: Doug is the project lead for CPAN Testers, so unsurprisingly that was his focus during the summit. His main task a new API for uploading test reports.

item.title: Mohawk's report
item.description: Mohawk mainly worked on ExtUtils::MakeMaker, but he also helped Ingy with Inline::C.

item.title: Leo Lapworth's report
item.description: Leo is the sysadmin for the MetaCPAN project, so a lot of his todo list related to the infrastructure, and also helped a few people get setup with the developer VM for MetaCPAN.

item.title: grep.metacpan.org at the Perl Toolchain Summit
item.description: Todd and his colleague Nicolas created grep.metacpan.org at the toolchain summit, with hosting courtesy of the MetaCPAN team.

item.title: Paul Johnson's report on Day 4
item.description: The fourth report in Paul's day-by-day series on the summit. He worked on Devel::Cover and CPAN Cover, just for a change.

item.title: Reviewing Perl 5 . in @INC at the Perl Toolchain Summit
item.description: One of the discussions at the summit was on the change in 5.26 where '.' (the current directory) is being dropped from @INC. These are Todd's notes from that discussion.

item.title: Olaf Alder's report
item.description: Olaf's report on how he spent the toolchain, hacking on a range of things related to MetaCPAN. Be sure to read all the way to the end, including the slightly scary story of things leaking from his plane!

item.title: 2017.20 Crossing The Alps
item.description: Liz's weekly round-up of Perl 6 news, which includes the Perl 6 happenings at toolchain summit.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: May 9th to 16th
item.description: The first release candidate for Perl 5.26 was released at the toolchain summit. Dot in @INC is still a topic.

item.title: Virtual Spring Cleaning (part 3 of XX) wherein one release begets another
item.description: More of Max's tidying up and releasing new code to CPAN.

item.title: Good things come in managed packages
item.description: ActiveState announced that going forward they'll focus on supporting regular CPAN tools for installing modules, rather than focussing on their own Perl Package Manager.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: #304 - That was the toolchain summit that was!
item.description:
The Perl Toolchain Summit ended last Sunday, and through this week the attendees have been blogging about what they did there. There's a lot to read, but hopefully it will illustrate why this is such a valued event.

There's also plenty of conference news; the season is almost upon us!

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
